intro: Hieracium sagittatum subsp. subunctiusculum, commonly known as the narrowleaf hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a distinctive silvery or whitish underside, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. This subspecies is generally herbaceous, with a low-growing habit and is often found in temperate climates.
